name: Bubbling Muck
text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a Swamp for mana, that player adds {B} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

editions.flavor: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.

name: Budoka Gardener
text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you control ten or more lands, flip Budoka Gardener.

name: Budoka Pupil
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Budoka Pupil.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Budoka Pupil, you may flip it.

name: Builder's Bane
text: Destroy X target artifacts. Builder's Bane deals damage to each player equal to the number of artifacts he or she controlled put into a graveyard this way.

editions.flavor: There is only so much a person may be buried with.

name: Builder's Blessing
text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

editions.flavor:
"Mix the mortar with holy wards, or blood will run in the streets."
—Vadvar, Thraben stonewright

name: Built to Last
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

editions.flavor: Consulate-built automatons have a lifetime warranty.

name: Built to Smash
text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. If it's an artifact creature, it gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Free from Consulate regulations, renegade-built automatons push performance to the limit.

name: Bull Aurochs
text:
Trample
Whenever Bull Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.

editions.flavor: The aurochs herd is content to graze—until the bull provides the dissenting urge to charge.

name: Bull Cerodon
text: Vigilance, haste

editions.flavor: It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.
It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.

name: Bull Elephant
text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I? —Zhalfirin riddle

Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Bull Hippo
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor:
"How could you not hear it approach? It's a hippo!"
—Argivian commander
Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

name: Bull Rush
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "It's gone mad! Loose the chains and save what you can!"

name: Bullwhip
text: {2}, {T}: Bullwhip deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature attacks this turn if able.

editions.flavor:
"Pain is a crude way to enforce obedience, but it is cheap and plentiful."
—Volrath

name: Bulwark
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Bulwark deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that player's hand.

editions.flavor: "It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last." —Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Bump in the Night
text:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's definitely something to worry about.
It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's definitely something to worry about.

name: Buoyancy
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

editions.flavor: Saprazzan merfolk become legged on land, but some find it quicker to bring the water with them.

name: Burden of Greed
text: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact he or she controls.

editions.flavor:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

name: Burden of Guilt
text:
Enchant creature
{1}: Tap enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Bureaucracy
text:
Pursuant to subsection 3.1(4) of Richard's Rules of Order, during the upkeep of each participant in this game of the Magic: The Gathering® trading card game (hereafter known as "PLAYER"), that PLAYER performs all actions in the sequence of previously added actions (hereafter known as "ACTION QUEUE"), in the order those actions were added, then adds another action to the end of the ACTION QUEUE. All actions must be simple physical or verbal actions that a player can perform while sitting in a chair, without jeopardizing the health and security of said PLAYER.
If any PLAYER does not perform all the prescribed actions in the correct order, sacrifice Bureaucracy and said PLAYER discards his or her complement of cards in hand (hereafter known as "HAND").

name: Burgeoning
text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The plants said, ‘We will fight the stone with root and stem and seed. We are patient. We will win.'"
—Skyshroud myth of the forest
The first vine shows the others where to grow.
The first vine shows the others where to grow.

name: Buried Alive
text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.
The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

"Is it worse to walk while dead, or to be buried alive? I have witnessed both."
—Crovax
The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.

name: Buried Ruin
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Buried Ruin: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: History has buried its treasures deep.
History has buried its treasures deep.
History has buried its treasures deep.

name: Burn
text:
Burn deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Burn at the Stake
text:
As an additional cost to cast Burn at the Stake, tap any number of untapped creatures you control.
Burn at the Stake deals damage to target creature or player equal to three times the number of creatures tapped this way.

name: Burn Away
text: Burn Away deals 6 damage to target creature. When that creature dies this turn, exile all cards from its controller's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Your corruption will burn, serpent, until there is nothing left to defile."
—Asmala, bloodfire mystic

"Your corruption will burn, serpent, until there is nothing left to defile."
—Asmala, bloodfire mystic

name: Burn from Within
text: Burn from Within deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature is dealt damage this way, it loses indestructible until end of turn. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

name: Burning Anger
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: "With rage as your forge, your hammer can smite anything."

name: Burning Cinder Fury of Crimson Chaos Fire
text:
Whenever any player taps a card, that player gives control of that card to an opponent at end of turn.
If a player does not tap any nonland cards during his or her turn, Burning Cinder Fury of Crimson Chaos Fire deals 3 damage to that player at end of turn.

name: Burning Cloak
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.

name: Burning Earth
text: Whenever a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, Burning Earth deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"Your world is formed from the same power that wraps my burning hand around your throat."
—Shrazik, lavamancer

name: Burning-Eye Zubera
text: When Burning-Eye Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, Burning-Eye Zubera deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Burning Fields
text: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent.

editions.flavor:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Burning Inquiry
text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.

editions.flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

name: Burning of Xinye
text: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

name: Burning Oil
text:
Burning Oil deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea.

name: Burning Palm Efreet
text: {1}{R}{R}: Burning Palm Efreet deals 2 damage to target creature with flying and that creature loses flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Even the lion envies the lark.

name: Burning Sands
text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.

editions.flavor:
"Pain teaches lessons no scholar can."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{R}{R}: Burning Shield Askari gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Any day that I ride my horse up to my ankles in the remains of my enemies is a good day."
—Akin, seasoned askari

name: Burning-Tree Bloodscale
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{2}{R}: Target creature can't block Burning-Tree Bloodscale this turn.

name: Burning-Tree Emissary
text: When Burning-Tree Emissary enters the battlefield, add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

name: Burning-Tree Shaman
text: Whenever a player activates an ability that isn't a mana ability, Burning-Tree Shaman deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor: Gruul shamans are bent on punishing the civilized. Any act more complex than rubbing sticks together or eating with utensils is met with the stinging burn of their magic.

name: Burning Vengeance
text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.
Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.

name: Burning Wish
text: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.

Flying
